result.execSummary:
The defendant Ehrin E. Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was specifically found to not be eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance abuse Program. Defendant was granted credit for 311 days served.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections  if not previously provided.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant is to complete a Sex Offender Assessment and follow all recommendations releasing the findings to the agent. Additionally, Defendant is to comply with regulations of the Sex Offender Registry Program.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  

Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  

The defendant shall have no contact with R.J.F. or the immediate family of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

Defendant is not allowed to have any unsupervised contact with persons under the age of 18 unless there is prior approval by the agent.

supervisions.notes: The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ehrin E. Scott
